title: Very familiar Sans Serif font.
content:
[Link](http://web.archive.org/web/20090822030855/http:/commons.wikimedia.org/w/thumb.php?f=Southgate%20Mall%20Logo.svg&width=1000px)

What font is used in the above link? Thanks.
author: Nunymare

comments.content: Is the font used elsewhere in the place you found it? I have a feeling this is a custom lettered logo.
Yes, it is. Give me a second.
I have a feeling that [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20090822030855/http:/theedmontonian.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/Picture-2.png) is set in the same typeface.

@Nunymare: Your two samples are not the same. (Look at the G’s)

The ’AUG 5’ typeface has been ID’d about 3 times this week. It’s [Gotham Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20090822030855/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_inside.php?wipID=22&productLineID=100008) by HFJ.
Ah. Does the ’Southgate’ ring a bell?

SOUTHGATE is Tangent Medium from Terminal Design:

[http://www.terminaldesign.com/fonts/characters/?ID=195](http://web.archive.org/web/20090822030855/http:/www.terminaldesign.com/fonts/characters/?ID=195 "http://www.terminaldesign.com/fonts/characters/?ID=195")

or

[http://www.terminaldesign.com/fonts/set/?CID=10](http://web.archive.org/web/20090822030855/http:/www.terminaldesign.com/fonts/set/?CID=10 "http://www.terminaldesign.com/fonts/set/?CID=10")

Mikey :-)
